sense.gloss: assistant, associate, vice-, sub-, deputy, substitute, auxiliary, supplementary, additional, collateral
to garnish, to accompany (as a card does a gift)
to add to as support, to prop up
to accompany (as an aid, guide, translator, etc.)
to draw something near to oneself, to approach nearby
deputy head, deputy director, vice chief (of something)

sdata.j: ↑改良↑↓かいりょう↓された↑医療↑↓いりょう↓↑技術↑↓ぎじゅつ↓は、↑宇宙↑↓うちゅう↓↑開発↑↓かいはつ↓↑計画↑↓けいかく↓の↑副産物↑↓ふくさんぶつ↓として↑派生↑↓はせい↓したものの↑一↑↓ひと↓つである。
sdata.e: Improved medical technology has been one of the spin-offs of the space program.

sdata.e: Some English adverbs function as adjectives.

sdata.e: This medicine has no side effects.
